Topic.Title: Trayvon was on top but who assaulted who first?

Message.Msg: "Did Zimmerman make the first move?" Probably ... look at the facts: (1) Zimmerman had called 911 numerous times on Black People. "Zimmerman prosecutors want to admit his five prior 911 calls about black suspicious characters" (2) Zimmerman carries a Firearm against Neighborhood Rules. "A manual published by the association for its "USAonWatch" program makes that very clear. "It should be emphasized to members that they do not possess police powers and they shall not carry weapons or pursue vehicles," the manual states." (3) Zimmerman followed Trayvon and confronted him. "Members should never confront suspicious persons who could be armed and dangerous." (4) Trayvon was NOT suspicious activity: "Here's why: The sheriffs' association manual lists the type of suspicious activity that should be reported to police. Among the examples: "Someone peering into car windows" and "broken doors or windows." Nowhere does it list walking while black, which is all Trayvon appeared to be doing as he made his way back to the house of his dad's fiancée after a candy run to 7-Eleven." (5) Zimmerman didn't follow the Dispatcher: "a dispatcher said he didn't need to follow the teen" ... but he did.

Topic.Title: Trayvon was on top but who assaulted who first?

Message.Msg: ""Did Zimmerman make the first move?" Probably ... " Probably not by any fair measure, certainly not beyond a reasonable doubt, it's your biased guess. If one is a juror and follows American law, one can sit and have such "feelings" but one needs to weigh what is shown, not what one thinks "probably" happened, that level is left for civil verdicts. Emotional, prejudicial “feelings” are not used where an innocent man, who was maybe jumped while returning to his car as instructed, is locked up for life. "Zimmerman prosecutors want to admit his five prior 911 calls about black suspicious characters" Of course they want that, they apparently have no evidence, their best hope is to prejudice the jury. If he is a watch guy and the people who are lurking about are black he should shut up, is that what you're saying? He apparently made many, many calls, only 5 were of black suspects? Carrying a firearm is just smart, he'd likely be dead today if he didn't. You apply moron rules for yourself, do the world a favor. Ask a cop volunteering during off hours if he would go on watch without a firearm. " Zimmerman followed Trayvon and confronted him." That is contrary to testimony, English challenged moe. Trayvon said he would not run away (State witness), Trayvon not Zimmerman was using racial terms (State witness). The first words spoken per the State is "why are you following me" supporting Zimmerman's version that Trayvon turned and confronted him. "Trayvon was NOT suspicious activity:" That's your spin, nothing more, he appeared to be looking into apartments and was loitering IN THE RAIN. Criminals love the rain you know, hides their tracks. "Zimmerman didn't follow the Dispatcher:" NO! THAT PREJUDICIAL STATEMENT IS COMMON AMONG YOU NON ENGLISH SPEAKING FOREIGNORS. He was following BEFORE told they didn't want that, then he quit per his testimony. Nothing you allege he did is illegal, much less ground for prison.

Topic.Title: Microsoft has failed

Message.Msg: It's nice to see this assessment confirms my own long-held views in certain ways -- in particular the view that Microsoft's main goal is to prosper by hurting competitors, not by helping customers. If customers benefit, that is only incidental. One might attempt to trace this to Bill Gates' upbringing, in which he was taught to be ruthlessly hypercompetitive, but that is a bit more speculative.

(where you got all your thoughts for your original post) says he would walk next to the apartments in the rain to prevent from getting wet ... listen more closely to him. Topic.Title: Trayvon was on top but who assaulted who first?

Message.Msg: "Phone calls, disobeying, following someone, carrying a firearm against rules ... etc." Again, third time, none of what you even ALLEGE is illegal, why the trial for non illegal things? You want to claim Zimmerman used poor judgment? In hindsight you will get some agreement. "Nothing you allege he did is illegal, much less ground for prison." According to you ... According to the law, name one thing you listed that is illegal. He had a right to follow. No evidence he disobeyed anyone, but if he did that is not illegal, rules are not law. Evidence released in the Trayvon Martin murder case indicates that the 17-year-old did not handle his killer's gun at all despite Zimmerman's claim that he grabbed for it during their fatal struggle." "Grabbed for it" is not handling it, ESL. That said, it was raining and a gun is normally lubricated, no DNA need be present if he did handle it.

Topic.Title: Trayvon was on top but who assaulted who first?
